mdRecord.dcterms:title: Saint James the Less Church, interior
St. James the Less, Pimlico
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Street, George Edmund (English architect, 1824-1881) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: St James the Less is an Anglican church in Pimlico, in the evangelical/charismatic tradition. From 'Old and New London' (1878): It is constructed of brick, with dressings of stone, marble, and alabaster; and it consists of a nave, side aisles, a semi-circular apse, and a lofty tower and spire. The roof of the chancel is groined, and is a combination of brick and stone. A very considerable amount of elaborate detail pervades the interior. The chancel is surrounded by screens of brass and iron, and over the chancel-arch is a well-executed fresco painting, by Mr. G. F. Watts, R.A., of "Our Saviour attended by Angels." Some of the windows are filled with stained glass. The building, including the decorations, cost upwards of Â£9,000. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/St_James_the_Less,_Pimlico [work]
